snippet: In federal courts in eight states including New York, “drug courts” for some defendants in nonviolent crimes have been embraced by a judiciary bristling at rigid sentencing guidelines.
abstract: Federal judges across country are teaming up with prosecutors to create special treatment programs for drug-addicted defendants who would otherwise face significant prison time; Justice Department has tentatively embraced new approach, which is aimed at sidestepping drug laws widely seen as overly punitive.
lead_paragraph: In federal courts in eight states including New York, “drug courts” for some defendants in nonviolent crimes have been embraced by a judiciary bristling at rigid sentencing guidelines.

headline.seo: U.S. Judges Offer Addicts a Way to Avoid Prison
headline.main: Outside Box, Federal Judges Offer Addicts a Free Path
headline.print_headline: Outside Box, U.S. Judges Offer Addicts New Path
